de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.sortable

Interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, NoChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractExpandableListAdapter, AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter, ExpandableListAdapterImplementation, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a sortable list of arbitrary group and child items, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Detail

      • sortGroups

        void sortGroups()
        Sorts the adapter's group items in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's group items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.

      • sortGroups

        void sortGroups(@NonNull
                Order order)
        Sorts the adapter's group items in a specific order. If the underlying data of the adapter's group items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the group items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortGroups

        void sortGroups(@Nullable
                java.util.Comparator<GroupType> comparator)
        Sorts the adapter's group items in an ascending order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used

      • sortGroups

        void sortGroups(@NonNull
                Order order,
                @Nullable
                java.util.Comparator<GroupType> comparator)
        Sorts the adapter's group items in a specific order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the group items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • addGroupSorted

        int addGroupSorted(@NonNull
                   GroupType group)
        Adds a specific group item to the adapter. If the adapter's groups are currently sorted, the group item will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, it will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null
        Returns:
        The index of the the group item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the group item has not been added

      • addGroupSorted

        int addGroupSorted(@NonNull
                   GroupType group,
                   @Nullable
                   java.util.Comparator<GroupType> comparator)
        Adds a specific group item to the adapter. If the adapter's groups are currently sorted, the group item will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, it will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group item may not be null
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        Returns:
        The index of the the group item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the item has not been added

      • addAllGroupsSorted

        boolean addAllGroupsSorted(@NonNull
                           java.util.Collection<? extends GroupType> groups)
        Adds all group items, which are contained by a specific collection, to the adapter. If the adapter's groups are currently sorted, the group items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        groups - The collection, which contains the group items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no group items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all group items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllGroupsSorted

        boolean addAllGroupsSorted(@NonNull
                           java.util.Collection<? extends GroupType> groups,
                           @Nullable
                           java.util.Comparator<GroupType> comparator)
        Adds all group items, which are contained by a specific collection, to the adapter. If the adapter's groups are currently sorted, the group items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        groups - The collection, which contains the group items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no group items should be added
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        Returns:
        True, if all group items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllGroupsSorted

        boolean addAllGroupsSorted(@NonNull
                           GroupType... groups)
        Adds all group items, which are contained by a specific array, to the adapter. If the adapter's groups are currently sorted, the group items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        groups - The array, which contains the group items, which should be added to the adapter, as an array of the generic type GroupType or an empty array, if no group items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all group items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllGroupsSorted

        boolean addAllGroupsSorted(@Nullable
                           java.util.Comparator<GroupType> comparator,
                           @NonNull
                           GroupType... groups)
        Adds all group items, which are contained by a specific array, to the adapter. If the adapter's groups are currently sorted, the group items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        groups - The array, which contains the group items, which should be added to the adapter, as an array of the generic type GroupType or an empty array, if no group items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all group items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • getGroupOrder

        Order getGroupOrder()
        Returns the current order of the adapter's group items.
        Returns:
        The current order of the adapter's group items as a value of the enum Order or null, if the adapter's group items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

        void sortChildren()
        Sorts all of the adapter's child items in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.

      • sortChildren

        void sortChildren(int groupIndex)
        Sorts the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, whose child items should be sorted, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • sortChildren

                  @NonNull
                  Order order)

        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, whose child items should be sorted, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the child items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

        void sortChildren(@NonNull
                  GroupType group)
        Sorts the child items of a specific group in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, whose child items should be sorted, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown

      • addChildSorted

        int addChildSorted(@NonNull
                   GroupType group,
                   @NonNull
                   ChildType child)
        Adds a specific child item to a specific group. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child item will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, it will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item should be added to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        child - The child item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The child item may not be null
        Returns:
        The index of the the child item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the child item has not been added

      • addChildSorted

        int addChildSorted(@NonNull
                   GroupType group,
                   @NonNull
                   ChildType child,
                   @Nullable
                   java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Adds a specific child item to a specific group. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child item will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, it will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item should be added to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        child - The child item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The child item may not be null
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        Returns:
        The index of the the child item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the child item has not been added

      • addChildSorted

        int addChildSorted(int groupIndex,
                   @NonNull
                   ChildType child)
        Adds a specific child item to the group, which belongs to a specific index. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child item will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, it will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item should be added to, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        child - The child item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The child item may not be null
        Returns:
        The index of the the child item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the child item has not been added

      • addChildSorted

        int addChildSorted(int groupIndex,
                   @NonNull
                   ChildType child,
                   @Nullable
                   java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Adds a specific child item to the group, which belongs to a specific index. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child item will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, it will be added at the end.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item should be added to, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        child - The child item, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The child item may not be null
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        Returns:
        The index of the the child item, which has been added to the adapter, as an Integer value or -1, if the child item has not been added

      • addAllChildrenSorted

        boolean addAllChildrenSorted(@NonNull
                             GroupType group,
                             @NonNull
                             java.util.Collection<? extends ChildType> children)
        Adds all child items, which are contained by a specific collection, to a specific group. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child items should be added to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        children - The collection, which contains the child items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no child items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all child items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllChildrenSorted

        boolean addAllChildrenSorted(@NonNull
                             GroupType group,
                             @NonNull
                             java.util.Collection<? extends ChildType> children,
                             @Nullable
                             java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Adds all child items, which are contained by a specific collection, to a specific group. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child items should be added to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        children - The collection, which contains the child items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no child items should be added
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        Returns:
        True, if all child items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllChildrenSorted

        boolean addAllChildrenSorted(int groupIndex,
                             @NonNull
                             java.util.Collection<? extends ChildType> children)
        Adds all child items, which are contained by a specific collection, to the group, which belongs to a specific index. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item should be added to, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        children - The collection, which contains the child items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no child items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all child items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllChildrenSorted

                             @NonNull
                             java.util.Collection<? extends ChildType> children,

                             java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator)
        Adds all child items, which are contained by a specific collection, to the group, which belongs to a specific index. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.

        children - The collection, which contains the child items, which should be added to the adapter, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no child items should be added
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used

        True, if all child items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllChildrenSorted

        boolean addAllChildrenSorted(@NonNull
                             GroupType group,
                             @NonNull
                             ChildType... children)
        Adds all child items, which are contained by a specific array, to a specific group. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child items should be added to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        children - The array, which contains the child items, which should be added to the adapter, as an array of the generic type ChildType or an empty array, if no child items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all child items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllChildrenSorted

        boolean addAllChildrenSorted(@Nullable
                             java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator,
                             @NonNull
                             GroupType group,
                             @NonNull
                             ChildType... children)
        Adds all child items, which are contained by a specific array, to a specific group. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        group - The group, the child items should be added to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        children - The array, which contains the child items, which should be added to the adapter, as an array of the generic type ChildType or an empty array, if no child items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all child items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllChildrenSorted

        boolean addAllChildrenSorted(int groupIndex,
                             @NonNull
                             ChildType... children)
        Adds all child items, which are contained by a specific array, to the group, which belongs to a specific index. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item should be added to, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        children - The array, which contains the child items, which should be added to the adapter, as an array of the generic type ChildType or an empty array, if no child items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all child items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • addAllChildrenSorted

        boolean addAllChildrenSorted(@Nullable
                             java.util.Comparator<ChildType> comparator,
                             int groupIndex,
                             @NonNull
                             ChildType... children)
        Adds all child items, which are contained by a specific array, to the group, which belongs to a specific index. If the group's children are currently sorted, the child items will be added at the correct position regarding the current order. Otherwise, they will be added at the end. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the child items, as an instance of the type Comparator or null, if the natural order should be used
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item should be added to, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        children - The array, which contains the child items, which should be added to the adapter, as an array of the generic type ChildType or an empty array, if no child items should be added
        Returns:
        True, if all child items have been added to the adapter, false otherwise

      • getChildOrder

        Order getChildOrder()
        Returns the current order of all child items, regardless of the group they belong to.
        Returns:
        The current order of the child items as a value of the enum Order or null, if not all child items have been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getChildOrder

        Order getChildOrder(@NonNull
                    GroupType group)
        Returns the current order of the child items of a specific group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the children, whose order should be returned, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The current order of the child items, which belong to the given group, as a value of the enum Order or null, if the child items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getChildOrder

        Order getChildOrder(int groupIndex)
        Returns the current order of the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the children, whose order should be returned, belong to, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The current order of the child items, which belong to the given group, as a value of the enum Order or null, if the child items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • addSortingListener

        void addSortingListener(@NonNull
                        ExpandableListSortingListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the class ExpandableListSortingListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeSortingListener

        void removeSortingListener(@NonNull
                           ExpandableListSortingListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the class ExpandableListSortingListener. The listener may not be null
